body.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the physical structure of a person or animal
body.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: My fingers were numb and my whole body ached.
He needs to overcome a negative body image (=what you think about your own body).
Your body temperature is higher in the daytime than at night.
For their body size, these birds lay very small eggs.
body.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the dead body of a person
body.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: A dog found the body of a girl in the woods.
body.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a group of people who work together to do a particular job or who are together for a particular purpose
body.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The British Medical Association is the doctors’ professional body.
Kaplan served on the governing body of the museum  (=the group who control the museum).
The student body (=all the students in a school or college) numbers 5,000.
The research will be used by government departments and other public bodies (=groups whose work is connected to the government).
The women moved towards the building in a body.
There were reports of a large body of armed men near the border.
body.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the central part of a person or animal’s body, not including the head, arms, legs, or wings
body.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Nick had bruises on his face and body.
The bird has a small body and long wings.
body.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: the main structure of a vehicle not including the engine, wheels etc
body.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Workers at the factory are making steel bodies for cars.
body.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: an object that is separate from other objects
body.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: Keep the caps on the bottles to prevent foreign bodies entering them  (=objects that should not be there).
body.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: if your hair has body, it is thick and healthy
body.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: This shampoo will give more body to your hair.
body.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: if food or an alcoholic drink has body, it has a strong flavour (=taste)
body.translation[0].definitions[7].examp: A small amount of tomato paste will give extra colour and body to the sauce.
body.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: the wide part of a musical instrument such as a violin or guitar, or of a sports racket (=bat)
body.translation[0].definitions[8].examp: The guitar is 16 inches wide across the body.
body.translation[0].definitions[9].defin: a type of tight-fitting shirt worn by women that fastens between their legs
body.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: There are billions of cells in an adult human body.
his drawings of the female body
Slowly raise your upper body into a sitting position.
Her whole body froze with fear.
You have exactly the right body weight for your height.
Exercise will raise your body temperature.
differences in body size and shape
Replace your body fluids by drinking lots of water.
Males have less body fat than females.
Nervousness is usually clearly expressed in body language.
People tend to have their own body image fixed in their minds.
body.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: the shape, size, and appearance of someone’s body
Many women are not happy with their bodies.
His clothes emphasized his strong body.
figure
a woman’s figure is the shape of her body – used especially when it is attractive
She has a really nice figure.
Freya had an enviably slim figure.
build
the size and shape of someone’s body – used in the following phrases
Police described the man as tall and of medium build.
He was of heavy build.
She has a very slight build.
physique
the size and appearance of someone’s body – used especially about men who look attractive
He was over 1.8 m tall with a muscular physique.
Ben has a very athletic physique.
a dead body
the dead body of a person
Her body was discovered at the bottom of a cliff.
Firefighters found the body of a woman in the house.
corpse
the dead body of a person. Corpse is is used when you are thinking about the body as an object rather than a person
Pathologists examined the corpse.
carcass
the dead body of an animal
a whale carcass
The carcasses of the infected animals were burned.
remains
parts of a dead person or animal, especially when they died a long time ago
Police found human remains under the floorboards of the house.
